title: Bitmap Transformer
about:
This project allows users to transform a non-palette bitmap image using simple command line arguments. Transformations include grayscale, a red hue, a mirrored image, all black, or inverted colors. This is an NPM installable package.

Includes: JavaScript, Node, Mocha, Chai, and Gulp

Source Code

title: Project Inoculation
about:
This project allows users to search for K-12 schools in Washington state and discover vaccine exemption and completion rates. Utilizes Google maps and Chart.js to visualize data.

Includes: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, Page.js, Chart.js, Heroku, Firebase, MVC structure, mobile-first design

Source Code

title: Welcome to Seattle
about:
This project provides users with a questionnaire to calculate the best Seattle neighborhood for their needs. Results include more detailed neighborhood information, Google maps, and an option to take notes.

Includes: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and Local Storage

Source Code

title: App-a-thon
about:
Planned and implemented a free hackathon for 45 Boys & Girls Club youth from the Portland metropolitan area.

Recruited and trained 14 skilled volunteers who led small teams through the process of brainstorming, wireframing, and programming an Android app. Served two meals, held a project fair, and provided participants with certificates and resources on continuing with computer science.
